rooms.Name: Skim an issue of Xmen
rooms.Description:
You see to the northern part of the room, a pile of Xmen comix.  You have
been wanting to read the few you missed for a long time.

ExtraDescs.Description: This is the authentic Giant-size X-Men #1

rooms.Name: A Comic Book Convention
rooms.Description:
Wow...there certainly are a lot of collectors here in this convention.  
You see collectors of all ages going through boxes and boxes of
comic books trying to find their favorite titles.  There are hundreds
and thousands of comics all lined up against the walls.  There's even
an Amazing Fantasy #15 (1st app. and origin Spider-Man) and a near-mint
Fantastic Four #1 (tm) (c) ... you begin to drool...

rooms.Name: Inside the Comic Book Convention
rooms.Description:
As you wander around the convention you see more and more boxes of
comic books being offered for sale.  There are dealers all around
you waiting to serve all buyers and traders.

rooms.Name: Inside the Comic Book Convention
rooms.Description:
Finally...you arrived at the last row of tables.  There's a dealer
here trying hard to sell his books.  The dealer is holding a strange
looking key...you wonder to yourself what kind of door would that      
key unlock.  Maybe its that small round-shaped door in front of you.

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
Welcome to Apocalypse City, New York!  -- the year is 1997, this city  
has become a battleground for the super beings.  The Kingpin, Dr. Doom,
and the Red Skull have joined forces to take over this city...they
plan to use this city as a base for their awesome criminal empire!
The villainous trio had also hire most of the world's deadliest super-
villains to safeguard their base from those super do-gooders.  However,
before they were able to completely takeover the city -- the super-  
heroes have decided to join forces to free the city from its captors.

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
You see more buildings and shops on fire -- the devastation is everywhere!
There's a lot of looting going on as the pandemonium spreads all around 
the city...it looks like the end of the world...

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
This is the main road in the city.  You see a lot of wrecked buildings 
all around you.  Shattered windows, broken glass, overturned automobiles...
it looks as though a tornado hit this city.  There are fire and smoke
everywhere.  You hear explosions from a distance...not far from where
you're standing!

rooms.Name: First National Bank
rooms.Description:
Like any other building in Apocalypse City this place has been looted 
and vandalized.  There are a lot of paper scattered on the floor.  The
thick steel safe has been blasted wide open.  The place is dead...

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
This is the main road in the city.  You see a lot of wrecked buildings 
all around you.  Shattered windows, broken glass, overturned automobiles...
it looks as though a tornado hit this city.  There are fire and smoke
everywhere.  You hear explosions from a distance...not far from where
you're standing!

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
Death and destruction are everywhere -- there are a lot screaming and
explosions all around you...  This city is really falling apart!
To the east of where you're standing you see a mini-mart and to the
west there's an abandoned building.

rooms.Name: A Quik-Stop Market
rooms.Description:
The building here is still burning.  There's a lot of smoke in here ...
you can't see a thing!  Maybe it's best if you get out of here before
that fire envelops this building.

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
Apocalypse City looks like Hell as you begin walking further north of 
Main Street.  There are super-beings here battling one another...it would
be wise not to get into the cross-fire.  
To the east you see a post office and to the west there's a street that
leads to the southwestern district of this city.

rooms.Name: The Post Office
rooms.Description:
Usually, Mr. Bisley the friendly postman would be standing by the door
ready to give you your mail... but like most people in the city he ended
up being a casualty of war.  There are no mail today -- the only mail
you see are the ones on fire or scattered on the floor.  The place has
been ransanked just like any other buildings here.

rooms.Name: An Arco gas station
rooms.Description:
There use to be a lot of cars coming by this place everyday.  But now
it's deserted.  Gas is useless here because the roads are mangled
and unsafe for automobiles.  The mini-mart inside the station has
been looted and set on fire.

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
This road seems endless.  The streets, shops, and buildings are all  
in ruins.  You can still hear the death screams and the cries for help.
There are punks here roaming the streets in search of someone who's
weak and defenseless...
To the west of you there's a strange dark alley -- looks dangerous.

rooms.Name: A local K-Mart store
rooms.Description:
Holy Mackeral!  Your parent's favorite shopping center is here.  This
is the place where your mom buys those cool Lee jeans and Trax shoes.
Wow...it seems the punks left behind a whole load of these nice 
merchandise.  You see your favorite snack bar just down aisle 14.  
Just being in this store makes you feel homesick...

rooms.Name: Marvel Main Street
rooms.Description:
This town is falling apart and probably wouldn't be able to recover from
this devastation.  You see punks and outcasts here killing off each 
other in senseless melees.  
To the west, there's a K-Mart store and to the east, you see a dark alley.

rooms.Name: End of Main Street
rooms.Description:
This is the tail end of Marvel Main Street...but it's no different from
the rest of this road.  There are burning buildings and explosions
from all around you.  Luckily for you this is not a DEAD end.  You can 
go northeast, northwest or DOWN...but beware of the choice you're about
to make...

rooms.Name: New York City Limits
rooms.Description:
You're on the border between New York City and Apocalypse City.  To the
east you see buildings everywhere.  There are a lot of traffic, a lot
of noise and even also a lot of smog.  You wonder if staying in 
Apocalypse City would heighten your chances of survival than entering
this New York City.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  As you go further east, you see something hidden in an alley
way...It looks like a secret passage way...

Exits.Description: That wall looks unstable, you might want to take a closer look.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: On the Streets of New York City
rooms.Description:
You're here in New York City trying to find your way around.  It's funny
how all those high rises look the same...even the residents here look
alike.  If you go any further from here you would only be MORE lost...

rooms.Name: The gates of the Avenger's Mansion
rooms.Description:
These are the gates which would take you into the Avenger's Mansion.  
From a distance you can see the majestic home of the greatest 
super-heroes on earth.  Theres a sign hanging on the brass gates.

ExtraDescs.Description: ** Trespassers: Beware of the Avenger's security systems **

rooms.Name: Inside the Avenger's Mansion
rooms.Description:
*RED ALERT!  RED ALERT!  RED ALERT!  RED ALERT!  RED ALERT!*
  *AN INTRUDER HAS ENTERED THE PREMISES -- ALL GUARDS BE ON ALERT!*

You have triggered the alarms...the guards should be here any moment... 
you might still have a chance to escape with your life if you leave now!

rooms.Name: The Halls of Glory
rooms.Description:
There are statues of the Avengers lines up against the walls.  As you
walk pass them you can't help but to admire the beauty of the statues--
how they reflect the brave Avengers as they fight the forces of darkness.

rooms.Name: The Coffee Room
rooms.Description:
The Avengers take their breaks here after saving the world.  There are
freshly baked doughnuts on the tables as well as some nice chocolate
pastries.  You smell the scent of freshly brewed coffee.  There's
also a comfortable couch here for you to sit and enjoy the snack.

rooms.Name: Trophy Room
rooms.Description:
There are hundreds and thousands of plaques hanging on the walls--each
complimenting on the heroic acts of the mighty Avengers.  There are
also trophies in display cases.  Every trophy seems to be made of
solid gold--the enscriptions on each of the trophies celebrates the
deeds of the Avengers.

rooms.Name: Avenger's Meeting Room
rooms.Description:
As you enter you notice a large, spacious room.  There's a big, round 
table in the center of the room and an even larger monitor on the
wall.  This is the Avenger's Meeting Room where the mighty heroes
discuss the activities of potential super-villains that they    
may encounter.

rooms.Name: A Secret Laboratory
rooms.Description:
This is the secret laboratory of the infamous High Evolutionary.  You
see many complex experiments going on everywhere in the lab.  There are
a lot of glassware shifting chemicals and mixing them together.  In
the center of this lab you see two pods which the High Evolutionary
uses to create his "New Men".

rooms.Name: Inside the Baxter Building
rooms.Description:
The Fantastic Four headquarters look quite spacious.  From the 
inside it looks HUGE.  There's a security guard here sitting 
behind his desk.  You see an elevator here that might probably
take you to meet the legendary Fantastic Four.

rooms.Name: The Fantastic Four's laboratory
rooms.Description:
There are amazing gadgets all around you.  You are astonished by the 
circuitry boards and the systematic diagrams in this room.  The
technology is way ahead of its time.  There's an elevator that can
take you to the top floor of this building.

rooms.Name: The Fantastic Four's conference room
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room, you see large monitors, charts, and maps
covering every square inch of the walls.  You're even more stunned
to see the Fantastic Four in person as they discuss their plans to
stop Doctor Doom from enslaving the world.

rooms.Name: Road to Hell
rooms.Description:
It's very dark in here.  You're also feeling a little hot...in fact, it     
gets hotter as you descend into this pit.  You begin to hear screams
of pain and agony...you hear voices--cries of mercy.  There's a stench
in the air...it smells like burning flesh.

rooms.Name: Deeper into Hell
rooms.Description:
It's HOT...Maybe you should think twice about going any down any further.
You hear more screams as you continue your journey.

rooms.Name: Mephisto's Underworld
rooms.Description:
You've entered into a dark unholy world.  You can feel the chill in 
your spine as the death screams echoes all around you.  There's a
putrid stench of decaying flesh...it makes you want to vomit.  To the
south of where you're standing you can sense an evil presence.

rooms.Name: Mephisto's Throne Room
rooms.Description:
"FOOLISH MORTAL...HOW DARE YOU ENTER MY SANCTUM...I'LL MAKE SURE YOU
 WON'T BE GETTING OUT OF HERE--ALIVE!"

This was probably the biggest mistake you've made in your life.  You
are now face to face with the Devil himself.  There are no gods that  
can save you...

rooms.Name: Parker Street
rooms.Description:
Like any other roads in Apocalypse City the streets are torned apart by
countless explosions.  Everywhere you look there seems to be fire and
smoke.  You see shattered glass covering the floor as you walk along
this path.

rooms.Name: Parker Street
rooms.Description:
The condition of this road is beginning to worsen.  There are a lot of
obstacles as you try advancing westward -- obstacles such as avoiding
the constant explosions and evading from the super-villains.

rooms.Name: Parker Street
rooms.Description:
As you advance westward you see more ruins -- there are burning buildings
and shops everywhere you look.  The air is clouded with smoke...  You
can hear the death screams of victims who are dying in this city war.
To the south of here there's a path...

rooms.Name: Parker Street
rooms.Description:
You are amazed at the total annihilation of this once glamourous city.
The streets are a rubble and so are the buildings and shops.  There's
fire everywhere you look.  The punks sure took care of this place...

rooms.Name: Xavier Avenue
rooms.Description:
You're at the half way point of this road.  Nothing new is here -- just
more crime.  You hear the screams of the victims of this senseless
violence.  The murdering punks are running on the streets searching  
for innocent civilians to rob and then kill.

rooms.Name: A Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
It's pretty dark in this gloomy, dank alley.  The smell is overwhelming...
You see glowing eyes in the darkness, staring at your every movement.
Those could be just cats -- but then again, cats aren't 6 feet tall...

rooms.Name: A Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
Whew!  Here's the end of this dark alley -- you feel relieved.  There 
seem to be light coming from a path west of here.

rooms.Name: A Path to Banner's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
There's not a lot of lighting here -- it's almost as dark as the alley
you came from.  You feel a little safer but who knows...  There is a
rumor of a creature who roams around this area...

rooms.Name: The Door to Banner's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
There's a strange dome-shaped building to the south of you.  It looks 
like a lab of some sort.  There's a large door that can take you
inside this complex.

rooms.Name: The End of Xavier Avenue
rooms.Description:
You've reached the end of this road.  It's amazing how you made it   
through the rubbles that use to be Xavier Street.  There's another
path to the west of you.  This path can take you to Cimmeria...

rooms.Name: The Path to Cimmeria
rooms.Description:
This road can lead you to the mysterious city of Cimmeria -- the city
of wealth.  But beware!  You may come across some mean, nasty savages
who could take your goodies and slit your throat...

rooms.Name: The Entrance to Cimmeria
rooms.Description:
You have reached Cimmeria--the land of savage barbarians.  Watch out 
for bandits and pirates, they'll mug you and who knows what else
they can do to you...  There is a legend of a warrior in this land--a
worshipper of Crom.  He is believed to be the most skilled in the arts
of battle.

rooms.Name: Xavier Avenue
rooms.Description:
Like any other roads in Apocalypse City the streets are torned apart by
countless explosions.  Everywhere you look there seems to be fire and
smoke.  You see shattered glass covering the floor as you walk along
this path.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Matt Murdock's Law Firm
rooms.Description:
Melrose Park Avenue used to be the largest business center in Apocalypse
City.  Matt Murdock was the most famous lawyer in this district.  If you
need any legal advice just make an appointment with him.  His office is
east of here.

rooms.Name: Melrose Park Avenue
rooms.Description:
Like any other roads in Apocalypse City the streets are torned apart by
countless explosions.  Everywhere you look there seems to be fire and
smoke.  You see shattered glass covering the floor as you walk along
this path.

rooms.Name: Melrose Park Avenue
rooms.Description:
The street is crawling with vermins -- not just the rats -- but the punks
here who rob and murder the innocent.  There's no justice in Apocalypse
City -- no cops would dare come into this town.  Damn, where's the 
Punisher when you need him?

rooms.Name: Byron's Lane
rooms.Description:
This street only spans a few blocks.  There's nothing here but ravaged
buildings and shops.  You see the melees on the streets -- punks and
outcasts murdering one another to see who would rule the streets.

rooms.Name: The Intersection of Byron's Lane and Xavier Avenue
rooms.Description:
Here's the intersection of the two main roads in this district.  Nothing
new here -- more punks, more prostitutes, more crime, etc.  The streets
here are a mess.  There's no cops here to protect the safety of the  
innocents and the super-heroes are preoccupied with the super-baddies.
You're left alone to fend for yourself...

rooms.Name: Byron's Lane
rooms.Description:
It's not easy to see through the smoke screen caused by the burning
buildings and automobiles.  The local punks here are searching for a
poor fool to beat up.  It would be smart not to catch their attention. 
To the east, you see a yellow-painted road...curious...

rooms.Name: A Yellow Brick Road
rooms.Description:
The yellow brick road begins here!  You wonder where this mystical road   
will take you.  Watch out!  You may fall into a trap -- the condition
of the road doesn't look too good...

rooms.Name: A Yellow Brick Road
rooms.Description:
Like any other roads in Apocalypse City the streets are torned apart by
countless explosions.  Everywhere you look there seems to be fire and
smoke.  You see shattered glass covering the floor as you walk along
this path.

rooms.Name: A Yellow Brick Road
rooms.Description:
The condition of the road is so bad that any automobiles which passes
here could cause the entire street to collapse into the sewers!
To the west, there's an abandoned building...

rooms.Name: An abandoned apartment building
rooms.Description:
There's no bellhop here to help you with your bags -- this place looks
deserted.  Look at all those cockroaches scattering around the floor --
disgusting...  This apartment complex is filthy and unsafe to live in.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Wizard's domain
rooms.Description:
Here's the end of the Yellow Brick Road.  The good wizard of Apocalypse
City could help you with your needs.  His sanctum is to the west of you.
The wizard-doctor is always willing to help anyone in need.

rooms.Name: Bruce Banner's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room you gasp in astonishment...there are machines
and wires all over the place.  Everywhere you look there seem to be
some mechanical operation in progress. In the far right corner of this
room, you see a figure of a man--yet it can't be a man--the figure is
way too huge to be any man!  Oh my gosh, you think to yourself, this
monster must have killed poor Doctor Banner...

rooms.Name: Inside the Palace of Cimmeria
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this Cimmerian Palace you notice the ancient architecture
of its interior.  The beauty of the stained windows...the palace looks
more like a church than a home of a king.  You see a man sitting on a
throne...he wears a nice fur cloak around his neck and a crown made
of solid gold and studded with the finest jewels.  He is Conan--the King
of Cimmeria.

rooms.Name: The office of Matt Murdock & Associates
rooms.Description:
There are piles and piles of paper stacked on the table ready to be     
processed.  It's a typical lawyer's office...a nice lazy-boy...some
decorative law books on a cheap plywood shelf...etc.  You sense that
Murdock must be a pretty boring guy.

rooms.Name: The Sanctum of Doctor Strange
rooms.Description:
The doctor's pad seems pretty tidy however it needs more lighting.  The
room you've entered looks quite spooky.  The whole place smells like
burning incense.  You sense there is a strange force in here--a power
of neither good nor evil--it's all around this house.  As you go further
westward, you notice a strange light...

rooms.Name: An Alternate Dimension
rooms.Description:
This is the room that Doctor Strange uses to keep his enemies from
getting out and terrorizing innocent people.  The concept of gravity
and time has no meaning here.  Watch out...you don't want to float
any further into this void...

rooms.Name: In a dark, dark alley
rooms.Description:
Boy, this place sure stinks...  There's a large dumpster here already
fill with decaying meat from the butcher's shop.  There are fecal matter
everywhere--on the floor and the walls.  So many flies and mosquitoes
flying around you.  Yuck!

rooms.Name: In a dark, dark alley
rooms.Description:
Boy, this place sure stinks...  There's a large dumpster here already
fill with decaying meat from the butcher's shop.  There are fecal matter
everywhere--on the floor and the walls.  So many flies and mosquitoes
flying around you.  Yuck!

rooms.Name: In a dark, dark alley
rooms.Description:
Boy, this place sure stinks...  There's a large dumpster here already
fill with decaying meat from the butcher's shop.  There are fecal matter
everywhere--on the floor and the walls.  So many flies and mosquitoes
flying around you.  Yuck!

rooms.Name: In a low-middle class district
rooms.Description:
Mostly students who have just graduated from college reside here.  The
rent is cheap but the risk of getting mugged is high.  The streets
here are dangerous even during the day.  Cops in Apocalypse City 
don't stop here often.  As you walk along this district you notice
a costume figure swinging on a rope.  The figure swooped into an
apartment northwest of where you're standing.

rooms.Name: Peter Parker's apartment
rooms.Description:
A nice and tidy apartment even though it's kind of small.  Everything 
here isn't worth stealing--maybe a burglar can get 10 bucks for that
black & white television.  The wall paper is becoming unglued to the
wall.  The floor boards creak as you walk into this apartment.

rooms.Name: Crime Alley
rooms.Description:
Crime Alley is not exactly a nice neighborhood to live in.  This is
the hangout for super-villains...  There are a lot of illegal 
activities going on here--even the cops are afraid to enter this
area.  Only fools would come into this alley so unless you have
super powers--don't even think about going any further down
this path

rooms.Name: Crime Alley
rooms.Description:
As you walk further eastwards you notice it begins to get darker and 
darker.  You wonder where is the tail end of this road...the dark
path seems endless.                    
You are lucky to still be alive...the villains further down this
road are quite aggressive.  As you continue your journey east you
notice there seems to be more and more villains around you...sweat
trickles down your brow...

rooms.Name: Crime Alley
rooms.Description:
As you walk further into this alley, you begin to shiver from the fear
of being attacked and murdered.  You can hear the cries for help and
the screams of pain as you walk into the darkness...
There's a bar to the north and a shopping mall to your south.

rooms.Name: A McDonalds restaurant
rooms.Description:
Welcome to Mickey Dee's!  This place use to serve hundreds of burger
lovers but now it's a home for transients and drug addicts.  Ronald
McDonald use to make frequent visits here to entertain the happy
children -- it's a shame that he wouldn't being making stops here    
anymore.  This place is crawling with rats and cockroaches -- maybe
you should reconsider trying to order that Double Quarter Pounder...

rooms.Name: Deadpool's Bar
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this place -- you see some costumed freaks drinking
some beers and chatting with friends.  The waitress tells you:
     "This is a bar for MUTANTS ONLY !  If you don't want to get
      hurt I suggest you leave here immediately !"
You're having second thoughts about going further into the bar.  The
guys here don't look too happy that an "inferior" non-mutant is
trying to invade their space...

rooms.Name: The Pool Room
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room, everyone starts staring at you.  They begin
to growl at first then they started coming closer to you...  You're in
pretty deep s**t.  The only exits are the door to your north or back
to where you came from.

rooms.Name: The Intersection of Crime Alley and 13th Street
rooms.Description:
Darkness is everywhere!  As you walk further into this alley, you can
feel the cold stares...  There are a lot of punks here who want a
piece of you.  You can see their switchblades glisten even in this dim
lighting.  They're waiting for a chance to attack you...
There's another road here which intersects Crime Alley.  It looks just
as dark and dangerous as the path you're walking on.

rooms.Name: Deadpool's Office
rooms.Description:
This office is very tidy and nicely furnished.  Deadpool uses this place
to operate his assassin-for-hire business.  He's sitting on his lazy-
boy just smoking his cigar.  Your presence doesn't alarm him -- he thinks
you're no threat to him.  Just remember...this guy is probably the best
assassin in the world...

rooms.Name: Mike's Gift Shop
rooms.Description:
It's pretty dark in here.  The place is full of cobwebs and dead rats.
There's a nauseating smell in this shop...something between a rotting
corpse and waste matter from a portable restroom.  Mike James, the 
owner of this shop, is nowhere to be found.

rooms.Name: Crime Alley
rooms.Description:
The punks living in this dump are beginning to notice you.  They   
begin moving towards you as though they are ready to strike...
You feel the cold sweat on your back dripping down your shirt.
If you run fast enough you might be able to make it to that gift  
shop to the south!

rooms.Name: At the end of Crime Alley
rooms.Description:
Finally...the long road ends here.  You have survived the many encounters
during your long journey.  However, there is one last encounter that you
must make--there's an evil mad man to the north of you--his name is
Doctor Doom...  Only you can stop him from destroying the world!

rooms.Name: The Gates to Castle Doom
rooms.Description:
You have arrived at the gates of Castle Doom...  The gates seems to be
unlocked as though the Doctor wanted you in his lair.  Doom is notorious
for torturing and mutilating his prisoners.  Maybe it's not a good
idea to disturb the him...

rooms.Name: 13th Street
rooms.Description:
This road is just as dark and dangerous as Crime Alley.  There are also
many super-villains here hanging around chatting among themselves.  
They're planning on something sinister...you better hope you're not
part of that plan...

rooms.Name: 13th Street
rooms.Description:
You've reached the end of 13th Street.  However, darkness still surrounds
you...you know there's danger all around you.  Maybe that sewage tunnel
to the east can be used as a sanctuary...

rooms.Name: A sewage tunnel
rooms.Description:
It smells pretty bad in here...you don't want to know what you're 
stepping on at this very moment.  This sewage tunnel is inhabited
by rats and maybe a few alligators.

rooms.Name: Further into the sewage tunnel
rooms.Description:
As you advance slowly down this tunnel...the smell of fecal matter and
urine begins to overwhelm you...you begin gasping for fresh air...
To the north of where you're standing there's a light source flickering
on and off.

rooms.Name: 13th Street
rooms.Description:
As you walk along this road, you felt something brushed against your leg.
You can't see a damn thing in this darkness.  There's heavy breathing as
you walk further into this alley...something or someone must be following
you!  There's nowhere to run...

rooms.Name: 13th Street
rooms.Description:
You bumped into a wall -- this must be the end of the street.  This is
quite a relief...  There's a faint light to the west.  It seems to lead
to a new path.

rooms.Name: A Dead End
rooms.Description:
You come to a complete halt--there's nothing here but a dead end.  You
notice a brick wall to the south of you...there seems to be light 
shining out from the many cracks on this wall...maybe it comes from the           
other side...

rooms.Name: Arden Fair Mall
rooms.Description:
Back when the super-villains were under control, Arden Fair Mall used
to be the happiest place in Apocalypse City.  But now it's nothing more
than a haven for low-lifes.  The shops in this mall has been ransacked
long ago.

rooms.Name: South end of Arden Fair Mall
rooms.Description:
As you walk further south of this mall you notice a road that would
lead you west of here.  There's nothing special to do around here.
You mind as well turn back or go west...

rooms.Name: A crooked path
rooms.Description:
This path must lead to somewhere...  The narrow path is pretty crooked.
It looks like it was made by automobiles passing by this area.  There
are a lot of tall weeds and grass on both sides of this road.

rooms.Name: End of the crooked path
rooms.Description:
The narrow path stops here.  You see a military camp south of here.  It
looks like someone is planning a war or maybe it's the U.S. army here
helping to clean the streets of these villains.

rooms.Name: A Very Dark Cave in the Sewers
rooms.Description:
The cave here looks huge...but that same smell of sewage is still        
present.  You see a burning candle on a cardboard box.  There are
some left-over Chinese food left on the ground.  It seems someone
is living here and maybe he's still in this cave...

rooms.Name: Inside Castle Doom
rooms.Description:
The castle look more spooky from the insides.  There are medieval
weapons and shields hanging on the grey-stone walls.  Along the
sides of the aisle you see knight armors erected upwards for display.
You notice a wooden door to the east of here.

rooms.Name: The guard room
rooms.Description:
Doctor Doom is no fool when it comes to security.  He has his robot       
guards here to secure the door to his throne room.  The room is
just packed with guards--but beware--once you attack one guard
the others may begin to attack you!  These robots are programmed
to stop any troublemakers in the castle.

rooms.Name: The Throne Room of Doctor Doom
rooms.Description:
"YOU PITIFUL FOOL--YOU DARE ENTER THIS ROOM--I'LL MAKE SURE
       YOU SUFFER A LONG AND PAINFUL DEATH!"

Doctor Doom, the king of Latveria and one of the most dangerous criminal
masterminds, has sentence you to die...  There's no way out--you must
kill or be killed.

rooms.Name: The Master Control Room
rooms.Description:
So this is the secret room behind the wall...  There are monitor screens
everywhere you look and a large control panel in the middle of the room.
Buttons and switches all over this place.  The room is dimly lighted.
Behind the shadows of a large chair...you hear laughter...  There's       
someone here!

rooms.Name: Hobgoblin's Hideout
rooms.Description:
This small room is loaded with various kinds of weapons...however, they're 
not the kind anyone besides the Hobgoblin would use.  There are pumpkin
bombs and an assortment of weapons that the Hobgoblin uses in battle.
There's a large stash of money on the floor, probably came from a heist.

rooms.Name: A military camp
rooms.Description:
Yikes...as you step into this camp you notice the soldiers here are
dress in Nazi outfits.  Something is definitely wrong...  You see
assault vehicles and tanks parked everywhere on this camp.  The         
soldiers here don't seem to notice that you've wandered into the
camp.  Their attention are directed toward a guy behind a podium.        
The guy behind the podium is wearing a red mask in the shape of a 
skull.  He speaks pretty loud and his audience seems to be under
a trance.

rooms.Name: Blood Valley
rooms.Description:
The roads in Blood Valley are just as damaged as the ones on Marvel Main.
There's destruction everywhere as you walk along here.  A fire is burning
the nearby shops and black clouds of smoke almost cover the sky.

rooms.Name: Blood Valley
rooms.Description:
As you walk along Blood Valley the condition of the roads worsen.  There
are a lot of cracks and pot holes everywhere on the streets...it looks
as though this section of the city is gonna collapse.

rooms.Name: Blood Valley
rooms.Description:
This is the halfway point of the road.  The punks here are more    
bloodthristy -- they want someone like you to come along so they
can rob you and who knows what these savages are capable of...

rooms.Name: Northern section of Blood Valley
rooms.Description:
The Northern section of Blood Valley leads to the northwestern district
of Apocalypse City.  To the northwest, you see a New York subway...it
sure looks pretty dark in there...  You can hear the howls and screams 
of drunken hoodlums from inside that tunnel.

rooms.Name: A Train Subway
rooms.Description:
You've walked into a typical New York subway.  It looks pretty dark down
here...you wonder if anyone up there can hear you scream.  The subway
is pretty long and as you walk along here, you can hear your footsteps
echo into the darkness ahead.

Exits.Description: It looks pretty dark in there...you can get lost very easy...
It looks pretty dark in there...you can get lost very easily.

rooms.Name: A Train Subway
rooms.Description:
You are surrounded by darkness...  Make sure you watch where you're
going because you can get LOST easily.  The punks down in these tunnels
are closing in on you.  They know you're here and they're out for your
blood !!  Run, You Fool, Run !!

Exits.Description: It looks dark in there...you can get lost very easily...
It's pretty dark in there...you can get lost very easily...

rooms.Name: A Train Subway
rooms.Description:
You can hear footsteps behind you...they're getting closer.  There's
no turning back now and screaming will do you no good -- this is a
"gang-land" subway and you're a trespasser.

Exits.Description: It's very dark in there...you can get lost very easily...
It's very dark in there...you can get lost very easily...

rooms.Name: A Train Subway
rooms.Description:
You're beginning to go CRAZY !!  All that running was pretty exhausting...
The sound of footsteps behind you suddenly disappear.  You've reached
the end of the subway !  To your north, there's a road and to the east,
you see more tunnel, more darkness...  If you're smart north is the
direction you should take.

Exits.Description: It's very dark in there...you can get lost very easily...

rooms.Name: A subway section under construction
rooms.Description:
This section of the subway is still under construction.  Maybe it's not
a good idea to wander into this area...who knows maybe this area could
collapse over your head.

rooms.Name: Area under construction
rooms.Description:
This subway section is still under construction.  However, due to the
riots on the streets construction has been delayed.  It's totally
dark in here...you can't see much because of the insufficient lighting.
But beneath where you're standing you can hear voices...there are   
people living in those sub-drainage tunnels.

rooms.Name: Capitol Mall Avenue
rooms.Description:
This is the main road in the city's northwestern district.  Unlike the
other roads in Apocalypse City the streets here are clean and "criminal
free."

rooms.Name: Capitol Mall Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you walk along this street you can't hear any sound of gun shots or
explosions.  There is only sound of birds to keep you company.  Like
any streets in Apocalypse City the road here is abandoned--no traffic
congestions, no honking, etc.

rooms.Name: Capitol Mall Avenue
rooms.Description:
This road must have been protected by the super-heroes during the
invasion of the super-villains.  There's no punks or drug dealers here.
This district was the only area that the terrible trio (Red Skull,     
Kingpin, and Dr. Doom) had not taken hostage.

rooms.Name: Western end of Capitol Mall Avenue
rooms.Description:
This is where the street ends.  To the west, you see a large building--
the walls and floor are made of marble.  There are six large columns
supporting the porch of this large complex.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Justice Department
rooms.Description:
The state government must have spent a bundle on maintenance and
construction of this building.  There's a large solid oak door to
your west.  It looks pretty tough to open...

rooms.Name: Forever Lost into the Darkness
rooms.Description:
You are completely LOST !!!  There's no way out of here...no matter where
you run you'll end up LOST !  Lucky for you, however, there's a drainage
tunnel that would take you back to Midgaard.

rooms.Name: An underground drainage tunnel
rooms.Description:
It's dark and dank in this underground drainage tunnel...  You can't
see anything except those pairs of glowing eyes.  There are          
definitely people living in this tunnel but who??
There are more tunnels to the west and a strange looking wall to     
your north.

Exits.Description: a wall that looks more like a secret door.

rooms.Name: An underground drainage tunnel
rooms.Description:
You can hear whispers in the darkness...  As you shine your light
source towards the end of the tunnel you can see the people who
lives here -- They are the Morlocks, mutant rejects, who vowed never
to live above ground with the "normals".

rooms.Name: An underground drainage tunnel
rooms.Description:
You've reached a dead-end.  Lucky for you the Morlocks aren't the  
aggressive types.  However, they might reconsider about not killing
you if you stick around any longer.

rooms.Name: An underground drainage tunnel
rooms.Description:
Here's another dead-end to the tunnel.  The Morlocks are becoming 
restless and frightened...they don't know why you're wandering in
their domain.  
There's something weird about the floor in this room...

Exits.Description: There seems to be a "secret door" leading down...

rooms.Name: An underground drainage tunnel
rooms.Description:
You've entered a very, very secret room !  No one has been here in
centuries.  There's a ton of money left here by someone...  You wonder
to yourself who could have left this money.  Could he still be in
the same room -- nah, he would be dead long ago...

rooms.Name: The Justice Department
rooms.Description:
And you thought the building from the outside looks incredible, the 
inside looks like Trump's Plaza.  This place is packed with state
officials who like to sit around all day and do nothing.

rooms.Name: The Justice Department
rooms.Description:
As you walk inside this glamourous building, you can see your favorite 
politicians running pass you.  They must be in a hurry, after all, it's
lunch time.
To the west, you see a door...

rooms.Name: The Justice Department
rooms.Description:
*Yawn*...the rooms in this building all look the same.  The paintings
and the sculptures are beginning to look more like cheap imitations.
To the north, you see a large door...

rooms.Name: S.H.I.E.L.D. Headquarter
rooms.Description:
You've entered the newly remodeled Shield Headquarter.  The rooms in
this HQ is much like the rooms in the justice department.  S.H.I.E.L.D.
was organized to bring down the criminal empires and to protect the
welfare of all Americans.

rooms.Name: S.H.I.E.L.D.'s meeting room
rooms.Description:
This is the room where the high-ranking Shield lieutenants discuss
their next mission.  You can see a large round table in the center
of the room.  On the walls, there seems to be hundreds of screens
covering it from corner to corner.

rooms.Name: S.H.I.E.L.D.'s strategy room
rooms.Description:
There are maps everywhere...on the walls and the desks.  This is the room
where Shield agents plan their assault on the enemy forces.  Strategy is
what Shield is famous for.
There's a door to the north...

rooms.Name: Captain America's Office
rooms.Description:
This room doesn't look anywhere like the entire Justice Department.  You
sense Captain America to be an ordinary man who doesn't think much
about conspicuous consumption.  There's a table in front of you with
tons of paper stacked on top.  The only electrical device here is a
phone with an answering machine.  Captain America is sitting here,
going through the piles of paper trying to find a case to solve.

rooms.Name: The office of Nick Fury
rooms.Description:
As you walk inside this room, you can see a lot of papers scattered
everywhere.  There are pieces of food lying on the floor.  This office
is obviously filthy.  You see a man with an eyepatch lying on a
couch sleeping and snoring very loudly.

rooms.Name: The Mole Man's Control Room
rooms.Description:
The technology in this room is way ahead of its time.  You can see
large monitors on the walls which are used to spy on the world above.
This is the secret control room of the Mole Man -- one of the
Fantastic Four's greatest enemies of all time.  He's planning on
taking over the world with his people...

rooms.Name: The hallway
rooms.Description:
As you walk along this glamourous structure, you can see the great 
statues of the gods themselves.  The statue of Odin and Thor stands
out the most -- they're the most two recognizable figures in the
Norse folklore...
There's a door to the south...

rooms.Name: A Dark, Dark Room
rooms.Description:
This room is so dimly lit... As you walk into this room you can hear
whispering and laughter.  There are Asgardians here and they're 
plotting something sinister...

rooms.Name: The room of Thor
rooms.Description:
This is the bedroom belonging to the son of Odin, the thunder god      
himself, Thor.  There's a large bed in the center of this room--it's
made of the finest oak.  Across the room, you can see Thor looking
out the window with his beloved, the lady Sif.

rooms.Name: The Throne Room of Odin
rooms.Description:
You've entered into the sacred room of the All-Father himself, the 
mighty Odin!  Coming into this room without authorization is punishable
by death.  Now prepare to DIE, you mortal fool...

rooms.Name: The hallway
rooms.Description:
There are three guys here guarding this area.  They don't look like
any ordinary Asgardian soldiers -- these three looks to be skilled in
the art of fighting.  They're guarding the rooms as though something
or someone in there was important.  
There's a door to the north and a hallway to the south.

rooms.Name: Valhalla's Bar
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this bar, you can see the Asgardians here drinking 
and singing.  This is the only place where Trolls and Asgardians come
together to chat and have a few beers.  
There's a door to the south...

rooms.Name: Inside the House of Odin
rooms.Description:
NO MORTAL has ever entered the House of Odin.  You will be severely 
punished by the All-Father himself if you're caught.  There are
guards everywhere in this castle...
There's a grand staircase that'll take you upstairs.

rooms.Name: Inside the Kingdom of Asgard
rooms.Description:
You are in awe as you walk into this fable city.  The large structures
here are covered in gold.  The roads themselves are made from the finest
marble.  
There's a bar to the southeast of here and to the northeast, a road     
that leads to the royal castle.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Asgard
rooms.Description:
The doors to the city of Asgard is to the east.  These large doors    
are made of pure gold and studded with rare jewels...  They look pretty
tough to open.

rooms.Name: Along the Rainbow Bridge
rooms.Description:
"STOP, MORTAL!  You may not go any further along this bridge and
      into the great kingdom of Asgard--return to where you came or
      else face the wrath of faithful Heimdall !"

You see a man dressed in a viking outfit... He seems to be pretty 
serious about what he'd said.

rooms.Name: The Rainbow Bridge
rooms.Description:
You're now walking on the infamous Rainbow Bridge of the Viking folklore.
This bridge is supposedly the passage to the realm known as Asgard.  As
you walk along this colorful road you can see large structures at the
very end.

rooms.Name: INTO THE BURNING BLUE STAR
rooms.Description:
You are surrounded by the flames of this sun--you feel your body begin
to melt.  Not even that armor you're wearing can save you.  The heat
is unbearable--you're crying out in pain !!!
Sorry, friend, your journey ends here.  However, if you somehow managed
to live through this...the merciful Gods of ROI have given you a chance
to get out of this DEATH-TRAP...you can go down to the temple.

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
What you see in this area of space is undescribable...  You see a huge,
alien creature drifting in the middle of space.  He's in a standing
position and doesn't look to be dead.  The giant is glowing with POWER
like a minature star.  You can sense he's no ordinary alien-being--he's
more like a GOD waiting for Judgement Day.
There's a large blue star very close to where you're standing...it would
be VERY STUPID to walk into this fiery hot star...

Exits.Description: This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT...like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P
This is an obvious DT, like you didn't know :P

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this area you notice a rather LARGE humanoid alien...
Who is this alien-being?  All he's doing now is just hovering over you,
watching your every movement.  He doesn't seem to pose any threat...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
This bridge leads just about anywhere in space.  As you walk into this
section of the bridge you notice a rather large man, or whatever it is,
standing on a metal platform.  He looks at you then turns his back.
You're nothing but a flea to Thanos the Titan!  He can crush you with
ease.  Try not to disturb him...you wouldn't wanna test his might...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
Finding your way around this space bridge is impossible...  You'll need
a map to find what you're looking for.  The bridge leads to all direction--
make sure you're not going in circles...

rooms.Name: Somewhere in Space...
rooms.Description:
You feel weird walking through this strange portal...  Everywhere is 
darkness.  The gravity here is totally different...you feel lighter.
You're walking on some sort of an invisible "bridge" which guides you
toward a certain destination.  The Skrulls must be using this bridge to
secretly invade worlds from other galaxy.  The space bridge leads to
all directions...

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
All that swimming is beginning to give you the cramps.  Your arms are
sore from the paddling.  If you don't get to shore in the next few
minutes you will surely drown.  As you swim westward, you notice a
man swimming towards you.  How could this be?  You must be hallucinating.
Who else could be stupid enough to swim the Atlantic Ocean?

rooms.Name: Gilligan's Island
rooms.Description:
Just sit right back and you'll hear a tale, a tale of a fateful trip...
that started from this tropic port aboard this tiny ship.  The mate was
a tiny, sailing man, the skipper, brave and sure.  Five passengers set
sail that day for a three-hour tour...a three-hour tour.
The weather started getting rough the tiny ship was lost.  If not for the
courage of the fearless crew the Minnow would be lost...the Minnow would
be lost.
--we know the rest of the story--7 people stranded on an island for
15 years and then decided that it was the place they wanted to stay for
the rest of their lives... (see the movie)...

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: The Atlantic Ocean
rooms.Description:
There's salty, green water everywhere you look.  It's too bad you 
don't have a compass with you...this ocean is so vast that even the
most experience sailors could get lost.  If you go further away from
the dock you'll only be more lost!

rooms.Name: James Memorial Park
rooms.Description:
The light is so blinding it's almost impossible to see who's here.     
Finally, your eyes begin to adjust to this light and what you see was
surprising.  There's a strange portal of some sort appearing in the
middle of nowhere.  You can see people coming out of this portal --
but these "people" are not human...  Their skin color is dark green
and they have big pointy ears.  Whoever they are, they certainly 
aren't from around here.  And with the alien weapons they're carrying
it looks like they're planning on some sort of an invasion!

rooms.Name: James Memorial Park
rooms.Description:
You arrived at the playgrounds.  That strange light is stronger!  You
can see shadows on the ground...and they're coming closer to your
direction.  You can hear them talking but the language is nothing
you've heard before...

rooms.Name: James Memorial Park
rooms.Description:
There's trees, grass, and benches everywhere.  You can see a playground
to your north.  The light from within this park is brighter...  As you 
walk further north, you can hear whispers.

rooms.Name: a shipping dock
rooms.Description:
This dock was used as a stop for large freighters but now it's purpose   
is to serve the drug trade.  You can see abandoned ships parked nearby.
There's no where to go...everywhere you look you see the vast ocean.

rooms.Name: Fisk Road
rooms.Description:
The western section of this road ends here.  There's a shipping dock
to the west.  You can see the endless ocean from here.  To the North,
you see a small community park...and -- what's this? -- there's a very
bright light coming from within...

rooms.Name: The office of the Kingpin
rooms.Description:
This room is quite large and nicely decorated.  You see a very BIG man
sitting on a very large chair.  He looks at you and begins laughing!
As he gets up from his chair he begins wielding his cane.  He's
coming towards you very slowly...  The only exit is back from where
you came -- RUN !!!

rooms.Name: Fisk Enterprise -- 4th Floor
rooms.Description:
You've reached the floor where Fisk's office is located.  You're getting
too close and Fisk knows this.  He's ready to kick your butt as soon as
you open that door.  But first -- you have to get pass Fisk's son, the
mysterious Rose...

rooms.Name: Fisk Enterprise -- 3rd Floor
rooms.Description:
You must think you're some STUD knocking out Typhoid Mary.  Heh, she's
just one of the many expendable servants of Wilson Fisk.  
You're on the 3rd floor of this building.  There's bound to be some 
kind of sercurity here...  Maybe it's that skinny guy in the wacky 
costume -- he doesn't look too tough...

rooms.Name: Fisk Enterprise -- 2nd Floor
rooms.Description:
There's more security here!  You may be able to pass the guards but you're
not gonna get pass one of Fisk's personal bodyguards.  She's psychotic
and very, very deadly...  Her name is Typhoid Mary and she wants to take
your heart out and eat it!!

rooms.Name: Fisk Enterprise -- 1st Floor
rooms.Description:
There are a few security guards walking around the first floor.  They're
checking id's to make sure no one tries to sneak upstairs.  The guards
would kick you out if they find out that you dont't have an appointment
with Mr. Fisk...

rooms.Name: Fisk Road
rooms.Description:
You ask yourself where would this road take you...  As you walk further
eastward you notice the shops and buildings here are all intact.  Who
in this world could possibly have the power to control the savage
punks and vandals on this street?

rooms.Name: End of Fisk Road
rooms.Description:
The street ends here...  As you were walking along Fisk Road you notice
that the street was quiet...  The punks and super-villains here act
differently here -- they're not as rowdy and rambunctious.
To the north, you see a tall building.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Wilson Fisk Enterprise
rooms.Description:
This is the entrance to a large white building belonging to none other
than Wilson Fisk, the multi-billionaire philanthropist.  There are two
large doors that can take you inside the building.  Mr. Fisk is a very
busy person so unless you have an appointment -- there's no way you
can get pass the securities...

rooms.Name: Intersection of Homicide Lane & Fisk Road
rooms.Description:
Here's the end of Homicide Lane.  It intersects another street -- Fisk
Road.  Fisk Road seems to be the only street besides Capitol Mall Ave.
that has not been ravaged.  It seems someone here doesn't want this
road to be damaged -- someone with a lot of power and influence...

rooms.Name: Homicide Lane
rooms.Description:
Nothing new here -- more devastation everywhere you look.  You are 
coming closer to the end of this road.  Your feet are beginning to
get tired from making great leaps to avoid the loose rubble on the
ravaged street.

rooms.Name: Homicide Lane
rooms.Description:
This road is in a pretty bad shape.  As you walk along this street, you are
careful not to step on the cracks and loose rubble.  The shops along this
road have been ransacked and set on fire.  You can see the black clouds of
smoke covering the sky above.

rooms.Name: Homicide Lane
rooms.Description:
This road looks pretty long and it goes way up north.  You notice the  
poor condition of the road.  No vehicles can go pass along this road...
not even an all-terrain vehicle.

rooms.Name: Punisher's hideout
rooms.Description:
This room is nothing you'd expect to see in an abandoned warehouse.  There
are tons of assault rifles and assorted weapons lying around.  It looks
like the entire garrison of Fort Bragg has left their artillery behind.
But no army is that stupid -- these weapons belong to ONE MAN.  His name
is Frank Castle aka the Punisher and he's ready to wage war on the 
Kingpin's criminal empire!

rooms.Name: an abandoned warehouse
rooms.Description:
The place is totally deserted.  It seems no one has been here for ages.
There are cobwebs everywhere.  The rats are the only living things in
this dump.  There's a door to the east -- it'll probably lead you to
the vacated manager's office.

rooms.Name: Dave's Junk Yard
rooms.Description:
There's nothing to do here...  All you see are old automobiles and a
large compactor.  There a large warehouse to the north of here.  It
looks abandoned -- probably nothing special.

rooms.Name: Dave's Junk Yard
rooms.Description:
As you go further into this junk yard, you ask yourself -- where's that
vicious guard dog...I thought all junk yards have a guard dog...  Just
when you're about to walk further you can hear a threatening growl!

rooms.Name: Dave's Junk Yard
rooms.Description:
Boy, this place is a MESS!  Everywhere you look, there are stripped
automobiles stacking on top of one another.  This junk yard is 
basically an auto-grave yard...  There doesn't seem to be anything
here that you'd want.

rooms.Name: Cannibal Hill
rooms.Description:
This road stops here!  The punks are gone now -- they know this is not
their territory.  You are quite exhausted from the running.  There is
a sign in the middle of the path.
To your north, there's a new path -- looks pretty safe and to the east,
there's a junk yard.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Welcome to the Northeastern District of
                      Apocalypse City !!!

rooms.Name: Cannibal Hill
rooms.Description:
The punks are everywhere...  They hunger for your blood.  The path is
beginning to open up but the punks are still after you.  No matter
how fast you run -- they'll catch up with you.  The only chance you
got is to fight them off.

rooms.Name: Cannibal Hill
rooms.Description:
The path begins to get darker and darker as you advance northwards...
This looks bad.  The rouguish punks are following your every movement.
Watch out!  They're about to strike...you're only chance is to RUN !!

rooms.Name: Cannibal Hill
rooms.Description:
What a strange name for this path...  You wonder to yourself where would
this road take you.  It looks pretty safe...hmmm, on the other hand, it
could be a trap of some clever punks to lure their victims.  This road
can take you to the northeastern district of Apocalypse City.

rooms.Name: Magics 'r' Us
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room, you notice a frail old man coming towards
you.  He tells you:

     "Good day, young traveler.  How may I serve you?"

This shop is filled with strange potions and ancient scrolls.  You
wonder to yourself why this store hasn't been looted or vandalized.
